alert.note: Alert for Howard; Nance; Sherman (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 25 at 10:59PM CDT until March 26 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Wet, slushy snow expected. A fairly narrow band of snow will continue developing northward and eastward overnight, while gradually ending from west to east. Snow amounts in Nance, Sherman and Howard counties will likely vary from less than one- half inch up to at least 2 inches, with localized slightly higher amounts possible especially in southern Howard County. Winds will not be overly-strong, with sustained speeds mainly 10 to 20 MPH and gusts to around 25 MPH, mainly from the north. * WHERE...Nance, Sherman and Howard Counties. * WHEN...Until 9 AM CDT Sunday, although most areas will likely see snow end by 7 AM. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions anywhere that slushy snow accumulates on roads and sidewalks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Due to the main snow band likely being no more than 30 miles in width, it must be emphasized that snow amounts will vary considerably across the Advisory area. While many places will receive 1 inch or less, isolated pockets of at least 2 inches inches are possible within the heart of the main band.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
